title: Virginia Military Institute
data: Resigned from VMI after freshman year to enlist as a private in the U.S. Marine Corps in 1918 ; became lieutenant general and most decorated Marine in U.S. history
Commander of U.S. Army X Corps during Korean War

During World War II , the U.S. Army used VMI to give technical education and training to soldiers who did not matriculate as cadets nor live within the VMI cadet system . Before becoming a filmmaker , he trained at VMI for 12 weeks
Fellow and past president of Society of Experimental Test Pilots and Fellow of Royal Aeronautical Society
U.S. Navy vice admiral , Deputy Commander , United States Transportation Command ( USTRANSCOM )
Superintendent of VMI , 1995-2002 ; Rhodes Scholar ; author
Professor of Military Science and Tactics at VMI ; Commanding General , U.S. Army 100th Infantry Division
U.S. Navy rear admiral , polar explorer , Medal of Honor recipient ( 1926 )
Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States ( 1949-67 ) , United States Attorney General ( 1945-49 )
Decorated USMC Major General during World War II
American civil rights activist and one of fifteen modern-day Anglican Church martyrs
Senior resident superior court judge in western North Carolina , 1983-2013 ; lawyer in Hickory and Franklin , North Carolina
Confederate Colonel ; Member of U.S. House of Representatives and Virginia House of Delegates
Confederate Colonel of the 38th Virginia Infantry , killed-in-action during Pickett 's Charge
section_text: VMI 's alumni include the current Governor of Virginia , the current Secretary of the Army , a Secretary of State , Secretary of Defense , a Nobel Peace Prize winner , Pulitzer Prize winners , 13 Rhodes Scholars , Medal of Honor recipients , an Academy Award winner , an Emmy Award and Golden Globe winner , a martyr recognized by the Episcopal Church , Senators and Representatives , Governors , Lieutenant Governors , a Supreme Court Justice , numerous college and university presidents , many business leaders ( presidents and CEOs ) and over 285 general and flag officers , including service chiefs for three of the four armed services Two recent Chiefs of Engineers of the Army Corps of Engineers , Lieutenant Generals Carl A. Strock and Robert B . Flowers , as well as Acting Chief of Engineers Major General `` Bo '' Temple , were VMI Civil Engineering graduates . [ 101 ]
